rationales.benevolence: He recognizes growing distance from family and also withdraws from local social connection.

rationales.conformity: He immediately agrees to the supervisor's narrowing request to avoid confrontation.
rationales.self_direction: He suppresses his own preferred research directions right after the meeting.

rationales.benevolence: He invests in a warm, clear conversation with his mother and feels reconnected.

rationales.stimulation: The larger cross-dialect idea energizes him and feels exciting on the walk.
rationales.conformity: He returns to the narrowed proposal to stay aligned with advisor and family expectations.
rationales.self_direction: He does not act on the direction he most wants in that moment.

rationales.conformity: He attends the social mainly because he reads it as expected professional behavior.
rationales.stimulation: He is pulled toward the riskier, less settled research path.

rationales.conformity: He submits the scoped proposal on time and within expected academic structure.
rationales.self_direction: He independently starts outlining the alternative idea for himself.
rationales.stimulation: He reports feeling most alive while exploring the new direction.

rationales.conformity: He gives his uncle the on-track narrative that fits family expectations.
rationales.self_direction: He conceals the dialect project instead of openly owning it.
He initiates a supervisor meeting and prepares his own outline to discuss.
rationales.stimulation: Printing and carrying the new idea shows willingness to pursue a novel path.
